programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: A serial bomber appears to be targeting Wall Street's elite; Maggie and OA search for a suspect who seems set on revenge; Dana deals with Spencer Briggs, a cocky profiler brought in to consult on the case.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: The daughter of a wealthy family is kidnapped in an attempt to gain notorious internet fame; Maggie and OA discover the kidnapper's plans go far beyond abduction.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: Maggie and Dana struggle to find justice for victims murdered by a serial killer; the mayor limits the investigation to cut costs.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: OA and Maggie team up with members of the FBI's Fugitives Department to track down a person wanted for murder who is also on America's Top 10 Most Wanted list.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: The team must take down a dangerous drug ring after an American diplomat is killed while being used as a pawn; Jubal and OA try to help friends from their past fight off their inner demons.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: When a controversial senior leader from Egypt comes to New York for a heart transplant, OA struggles to balance his personal opinion with his professional duty when he is assigned to the security detail.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Mike Hammer is a big fan and old friend of Buzz MacClaine, a popular mystery writer, and the author asks the private eye to help edit his latest work. When Buzz meets his own violent end, Mike Hammer takes on the case to find the killer. But in this case, life seems to imitate art. Hammer and his team realize that his manuscript is filled with clues to an actual crime, and they must decode the mystery novel in order to find Buzz's killer.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: There's more than just paint on the walls when Mike tries to help Velda after her boyfriend, an artist, is murdered in his studio before an exhibition. But Hammer struggles to connect the dots in this mysterious case, and a long list of suspects emerges when he discovers that the artist often made others see red. Could it be the artist's jealous ex, the wealthy art collector, the corrupted art critic, the gallery owner, or even Velda herself?

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Hammer's on-again off-again flame is a Broadway star named Linda Fortunato, but her latest role is as primary suspect in the murder investigation of her ex-husband and co-star. The whole city is convinced of her guilt after the spatting couple was seen fighting during rehearsals, but Mike Hammer is determined to clear her name. Drama and mystery unfold while Hammer investigates a whole cast of suspects.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: After being released from his time in prison, Mike Hammer's old friend Herman Simpson joins him for dinner. The discussion turns techie when Simpson brings up the computer revolution that is underway. However, a bank robbery involving this same technology-- and a suspiciously similar criminal --takes place the same evening. Simpson becomes the prime suspect, and Hammer is his only hope at staying free.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: A federal agent's murder is linked to an ancient system of money transfer; Granger and Kensi work with the team from Afghanistan.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team and an undercover DEA agent must determine if an explosion at a fish market was an act of terror or a smuggling deal gone wrong; a helicopter crash may be tied to Kensi and Granger's search for the white ghost.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: An apartment fire with connections to a rape and attempted murder leads to a joint investigation with the CPD and Sgt. Benson of the NYPD's Special Victims Unit; Dawson risks her life during a call.

programme.desc: Sgt. Voight encourages Lt. Casey to go under cover in order to obtain proof of Jack Nesbitt's shady dealings; tensions grow between Otis and Severide; Herrmann helps another member of the firehouse.

programme.desc: During an undercover operation, Lt. Casey lands in very dangerous territory; Dawson's suspicions are confirmed; a new candidate (Steven R. McQueen) makes an unusual first impression; a protest hinders firefighters who are trying to battle a blaze.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Members of the firehouse band together to help one of their own; Herrmann looks for a way to reopen Molly's; Severide struggles to deal with one of his toughest days as he looks into the arson investigation.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Boden steps up to host a neighborhood wedding that was ruined by a fire; Chief Riddle's political aspirations cause friction at the firehouse; Severide fights his way back to his old position.

programme.desc: Chief Boden's new neighbor asks him for a favor; tension escalates between Severide and Captain Patterson; Cruz receives a surprise visitor; Mouch and Herrmann are excited to receive concert tickets to see Rush.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Boden thinks he's being set up by his neighbor; Severide's father pays him an unexpected visit; romance is in the air at the Chicago Fire Department gala.

programme.title: Chicago Fire

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Members of Firehouse 51 are unhappy when Patterson fills in for Boden while he tries to clear his name; Severide may have found Serena; Chili and Jimmy attract more attention than they expected.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: A member of Firehouse 51 is treated for life-threatening injuries; Cruz searches for Freddie; Mouch has a surprise for Trudy; Chili's behavior worries Brett and Jimmy.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: The city prepares for a tornado; Brett is forced to go to Boden about Chili's erratic behavior; Otis asks Dawson for help with his women trouble; the Department of Homeland Security asks Severide for assistance with a suspicious home.

programme.title: Acapulco H.E.A.T.
programme.desc: A widow needs the team to prove her husband is really dead and not faking it, but their investigation reveals that the man has several other grieving wives.

programme.title: Acapulco H.E.A.T.
programme.desc: The murder of a soldier and a string of arms thefts leads an army colonel to hire the team to secretly investigate the crimes.

programme.title: Acapulco H.E.A.T.
programme.desc: A film director hires the H.E.A.T. team to investigate a series of accidents that occurred on the set.

programme.title: Acapulco H.E.A.T.

programme.desc: The NCIS team investigates when a Navy drone pilot is murdered after using a black market drone to obtain military surveillance.

programme.desc: When an Australian Royal Navy Lieutenant is murdered in New Orleans, Special Agent Naomi Parsons (Kate Beahan) is sent to work with Special Agent Pride.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: An extremely intelligent Navy coder -- employed by Brody's mom (Annie Potts) -- is put in danger when the heart intended for him is stolen.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: After traveling to Texas to escort a key witness to the trial of an infamous arms dealer, Sonja and Special Agent Pride are ambushed.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Frank must decide about implementing a more rigorous fitness test after an officer has trouble keeping up with his partner; Danny is hesitant to pursue a cold case after learning who the original detective was; Anthony begs Erin to stall a trial.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: After someone breaks into Luis Delgado's home and kills his wife, Luis and Danny team up to take down the vicious murderer who may also be responsible for Linda's death; Frank finally meets Eddie's mother; Jamie and Erin are at odds.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Erin must convince Frank to back a new state police bill as part of a bargain she made with Gov. Mendez; Danny and Baez pursue the same perp twice after the DA's office is unconvinced by their initial lineup; a cop killer comes up for parole.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: DNA evidence in a murder case leads Danny and Baez to identical twins with identical alibis; Frank learns Nicky is interviewing for a job at the Justice Coalition, which he rarely sees eye-to-eye with; Jamie visits Eddie's father in prison.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: As Jamie and Eddie's wedding day approaches, Erin interviews a witness whose story leads her to doubt Eddie's honesty; Danny and Baez unravel the complicated love life of a young man who was murdered; Frank squabbles with the top brass.

programme.title: Blue Bloods

programme.desc: Frank's esteem for an old friend proves to be a mistake; Jamie asks Erin for help apprehending a perp who shot at him after learning she chose not to send him to prison six months ago; Eddie clashes with her new boss.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: Area 51 is considered the ultimate top secret facility, one that UFO investigators believe houses an extraterrestrial secret. But is there an even more secretive facility? In Dugway, UT, there is a remote testing facility sometimes referred to as Area 52.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: From microscopic particles, to large pieces of unknown metal--UFO "trace cases" offer some of the most convincing evidence that UFOs may have been visiting earth for centuries.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: On October 26, 1994, the U.S. government made their first official acknowledgement of Area 51. Six months later, nearly 4,000 acres of previously public land surrounding the base were closed.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: On April 19, 1897, the Dallas Morning News reported a mysterious airship had crashed into a windmill in the nearby town of Aurora, Texas. Townspeople were said to have found an alien body and buried it in the local graveyard.

programme.desc: Reports of a dinosaur living in the African Congo, strange lights above the Hessdalen Valley in Norway, a 12-year-old girl in Russia with superhuman strength, and proof of an alien structure on an asteroid.

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.desc: The truth behind internet videos of acrobats flipping over speeding cars; investigating an amorphous and horrifying crawling creature.

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.desc: A Tennessee man may have captured footage of the infamous Dogman creature without realizing it; communicating with extraterrestrials using a laser pointer; a giant structure at the bottom of a lake may be an underwater Stonehenge.

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.desc: An unidentified creature washed up on the beach; an object is seen over the skies of inner Mongolia; Tony Harris and his team of experts examine new videos and photographs to reach a verdict on what's behind strange happenings.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Modern prophets. Catastrophic premonitions. Dreams of future crimes. Can people really predict the future?

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: How do some people live through the impossible? Remarkable tales of human survival force us to reconsider what we know about our own will to live.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Throughout history, humans have buried their dead in caves or chambers, in pyramids or in some form of a tomb; ancient tombs were visual memorials for the dead; in China, a vast necropolis was constructed as a way to connect to the afterlife.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Throughout history, many have believed that certain places, things, or even people can be tainted with dark curses. Ominous lakes that morph into watery graves.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: What makes us want to create magnificent buildings that are bigger and grander than ourselves--and last for centuries?

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: The total disregard for life exhibited by serial killers shocks our sense of humanity and makes us question our safety and security.

programme.desc: Scientists are involved in a never-ending quest to understand the vast universe the planet inhabits; it seems that for each answer science provides, even more questions arise.

programme.title: Monster in My Family
programme.desc: In the course of one year, 1984--1985, Richard Ramirez conducted a reign of terror over Los Angeles.

programme.title: Close Encounters with Evil
programme.desc: When Tony Antonucci took up an apprenticeship with local contractor John Wayne Gacy, he had no idea that his new boss was an active serial killer.

programme.title: Close Encounters with Evil
programme.desc: Rhonda Stapley was a student at the University of Utah when she was attacked by one of America's most infamous serial killers.

programme.title: Close Encounters with Evil
programme.desc: In 1979, US army medic, Billy Joe Capshaw, was stationed in Germany. He had no idea that his roommate was a notorious serial killer named Jeffrey Dahmer.

programme.title: Vanished in Paradise: The Untold Story
programme.desc: Hannah Upp, a 32-year-old teacher, vanishes in the U.S. Virgin Islands in 2017 in the chaotic days between two major hurricanes; her family and friends believe that she may be lost and wandering in a "fugue state," a rare form of temporary amnesia.

programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: When 19-year-old aspiring artist Sarah Stern goes missing just weeks before Christmas 2016, investigators initially suspect she may have committed suicide or run away from home.

programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: On October 20, 2014, white Chicago PD Officer Jason Van Dyke fatally shoots 17-year-old African American Laquan McDonald in an act that he and the Chicago PD called self-defense.

programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: Model and mother Samira Frasch loves the spotlight, but when her glamorous life ends unexpectedly in her pool, investigators turn their eyes toward the web of heated relationships surrounding her family.

programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: Beloved 60-year-old chiropractor Mary Yoder falls violently ill and is rushed to the hospital; two days later, she dies, leaving her family and friends in a state of stunned disbelief; Mary's autopsy report reveals she didn't die of natural causes.

programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: In February 2014, Houston police receive a tip from a conscientious bail bondsman that a murder-for-hire plot is in the works and a woman's life may be in danger.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Ekstensive turns a stock 2020 Denali dually into a frame-dropping, show-stopping work truck; as a final touch, Bill handmakes articulating speakers for the bed; Bill takes a family's minds off their brush with a custom 2019 Polaris Ranger.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The guys bring a 1964 Lincoln back with a late-model Coyote engine and handmade interior; the Sling-Ray is a custom automotive sensation, but Ekstensive has what it's been missing.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 1971 Suburban returns to the shop for "phase two," wanting more power and custom metalwork; when a client finds parts and pieces of a '68 C10, Bill and the crew set on a new course for a ground-up build.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill gets déjà vu on a 1985 Chevy C10 square body; a handmade chassis; after a close call, Ekstensive makes a 1923 T-Bucket street safe.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Rocker Ted Nugent brings in his beloved '74 Bronco; Bill and the guys make an all-terrain beast unlike any other; With his creative sparks flying, Bill gets going on a build he's dreamed about for years: a handmade, all-tube, off-road buggy.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A local client wants the teams help to surprise his dad with a custom 1946 Ford Coupe; Bill goes for a mix of both classy and supercharged when working on his wife's 2021 Escalade.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Ekstensive needs a new shop truck, Bill and the guys go sky-high with a lifted '21 F-450 King Ranch capable of hauling over 20,000 pounds; with most of the '46 Ford Coupe body beyond repair, the team has no choice but to build from the ground up.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The guys hit the home stretch on the '46 Ford Blue Thunder, its once-rusted shell now rebuilt into a one-of-one showstopper; Bill is surprised when John Cena drops off a '69 MGC.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Builds include a 1979 Little Red Express and a Suzuki Samurai lake crosser.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Builds include a Samurai rock crawler and a Gladiator with a Hellcat.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Mod Mafia transforms a fire-damaged M1038 Humvee ambulance into an extreme camping overlander; the Wide Open Garage team builds a bulletproof race car for the appropriately billed Death Car Race, in which drivers are blindfolded.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: A request about a 1947 Ford truck becomes 1 Way Diesel Performance's next ground-up build; Mod Mafia jumps into uncharted territory with a Viper ACRX race car.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Looking into what happens if a Cummins diesel engine is put into a 2004 Lamborghini Gallardo; a customer wants Wide Open Garage to turn an old, rusted Chevy truck into a lifted, all-terrain truck on huge 74-inch tires.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Putting a twin-turbo Cummins into a 2004 Lamborghini Gallardo is a monster build unlike any other for 1 Way Diesel Performance. YouTube's "Unspeakable" star Nathan Graham asks Mod Mafia to help him out of a jam with his all-terrain, amphibious SHERP.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: The 1991 Land Rover Defender is known for ruggedness and simplicity; Mod Mafia does a reboot of a tired, old Defender with modern performance, power and custom luxury; Wide Open Garage takes an old-school Bronco monster truck into overdrive.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Social media star Liver King not only wants Mod Mafia to beef up his prized 2001 H1 Hummer's performance, he wants to customize it for his primal lifestyle; the team at Wide Open Garage must build a custom off-road truck completely from scratch.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Wide Open Garage's mega-truck build gets even bigger as they take an old-school '82 C10 square body and create a one-of-one show truck, monster truck; one Way Diesel Performance lives up to their name by giving an '88 Silverado more than 1,200 horsepower.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: 1 Way Diesel Performance is thrown a mega-curveball with a classic '48 Dodge Power Wagon. In a race pitting garage vs. garage, a 2,700hp diesel truck hits the line against a turbocharged first-generation Camaro.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Browns running back Nick Chubb scored a 2-yard, go-ahead touchdown with 57 seconds left, and Steelers quarterback Russell Wilson's Hail Mary attempt was batted down in the end zone as time expired as Cleveland wins in the snow 24-19 over Pittsburgh.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Pittsburgh's defense stifled Lamar Jackson and the NFL's top-ranked offense on Sunday as the Steelers topped their AFC North rivals behind Chris Boswell's franchise-tying six field goals in an 18-16 victory.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: 10/01/07: After winning 13 of their last 14 games, the Rockies forced a Game 163 against the Padres with the NL Wild Card on the line. It would take 13 innings, but Colorado's historic run would continue thanks to a walk-off sacrifice fly.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Dodgers' ace Clayton Kershaw strikes out 15 Rockies in a near-perfect no-hitter.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: 5/20/06: Giants slugger Barry Bonds crushes his 714th career home run, tying Babe Ruth on the all-time list.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Mark McGwire crushes his 69th and 70th home runs on the final day of the season for the Cardinals.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: World Series Film from 1980 highlights the Phillies capturing their first win in their 98-year span.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 1981 matchup between the Dodgers and the Yankees. New York took a 2-0 series lead, but Los Angeles battled back behind strong pitching and a deep lineup to secure the World Series championship.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 1986 matchup between the Mets and the Red Sox. A famous error in the 10th inning of Game 6 from Boston's Bill Buckner helped New York rally from a 3-2 series deficit and take home the World Series championship.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: The first World Series to be played in an indoor ballpark, the Twins used their familiarity with the Metrodome to their advantage to capture their first World Series Championship since moving to Minnesota.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: Energized by an unthinkable pinch-hit walk-off homer from Kirk Gibson, the Los Angeles Dodgers rally to upset the Oakland Athletics in five games to win the 1988 World Series.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 1991 matchup between the Twins and the Braves. Both teams went from worst to first before battling it out in a close series that showcased five games decided by one run and the Twins securing the World Series title.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: For years the Braves ruled the NL like no team since the Dodgers of the 1950s. And like Brooklyn, Atlanta found itself turned away time and again in October. With the additions of youth and spunk, it was time for the Team of the 90s to get their Title.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 1996 matchup between the Yankees and the Braves. Rookie of the Year Derek Jeter led New York from a 2-0 deficit to win four straight and bring the World Series back to the Bronx for the first time in almost 20 years.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 1997 matchup between the Marlins and the Indians. A back and forth series between Florida and Cleveland, the Marlins walked it off in the 11th inning of Game 7 to give the team its first World Series championship.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: Having set a modern-day record for most wins in the regular season, the Yankees faced the Padres and established themselves as one of the best teams to ever put on the Pinstripes.

programme.title: World Series Film

programme.title: The Nightcap
programme.desc: On The Nightcap we explore and question other lifestyles and cultures with an enthusiastic, open mind and hope to leave our viewers happily pondering new perspectives. The show's unique set has a full bar with a rotating cast of bartenders pouring up unique cocktails you can try to replicate at home. Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. programme.desc: Manny is haunted by his past when two juvenile delinquents from his hometown arrive at Baywatch.

programme.title: A Bell Family Christmas
programme.desc: Secrets come to light as the Bell family celebrates Christmas in their new home in this story of family, friendship, faith, and forgiveness.

programme.title: A Miracle on Christmas Lake
programme.desc: After suffering the loss of his best friend Charlie on Christmas Eve, sixteen year old Bobby Whiteside ventures out onto the lake where they played countless games of winter hockey. Upon shoveling the ice surface he makes a shocking discovery --- a magic, perfectly groomed hockey rink that appears only at night and only in his presence. When a local construction company purchases the land for development, Bobby must join forces with his high school crush, rally the town, and play one last game on the night pond --- with an old friend.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Tug of Words

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Mesmerized by Bon Bon’s Belly Dancing, we catch up with our favourite Big Balls in the Qualifier. They dish out punishment to Australia’s very own female Jim Carrey and send Big Cat tamer Robbie into the pond. Goofy Goggles up the ante on the Dreadmill causing the Breakdancing Dad to create hilarious new moves. Golden Guns, Marisa battles it out for the ladies against Perfect Specimen, Seamus in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s no doubt that the ‘Ball Crusher’ Sweeper is the star of tonight’s show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this week’s Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. It’s all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. ‘Nat with the Tats’ and Renee ‘Lets get physical’ move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. It’s a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Derek Creagh, Brian McCann and Niall McKenna deliver their desserts but which dish will earn top marks; strawberry and elderflower jelly with doughnuts and duck egg ice cream, poached rhubarb with lavender ice cream or brandy strawberry parfait with basil ice cream?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only one chef can make it through to the finals to represent Northern Ireland and get the chance to cook at the banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales, but who is going to come out on top?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: They kick things off with their starters, but which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be a wild rabbit with ham hock, carrots, asparagus and morels; wild rabbit with a baby leaf salad, black pudding, crispy quail's egg, broad beans and a shot of real ale; or warm pork and apple pie with chilled tomato soup, Yorkshire cheeses and homemade pickle?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: line-caught North Sea mackerel with gooseberries; pickled shellfish and wood smoked crispy prawns with the `smell of the sea'; and smoked trout soup with beetroot, cucumber and oyster nuggets.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Kenny Atkinson, Tim Bilton and Lee Bennett are determined to win but which dish will take first place? Will it be roe deer with beetroot, cauliflower and sage; venison three ways with English garden vegetables; or braised feather blade of beef and Yorkshire pudding with beer and onion gravy?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Which dessert will earn top marks? Strawberry jelly crumble with elderflower custard; a `Best of British' dessert plate - bread and butter pudding, rhubarb and custard, curd tart and strawberries and cream; or brandy snap with cider brandy cream, basil sorbet and summer fruits?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only one chef can make it through to the finals to represent the North East and get the chance to cook at the banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is going to come out on top?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only two chefs can make it through to cook for the Great British Menu judges at the end of the week and one will be going home. That decision lies with former champion Marcus Wareing, who will scrutinise their dishes every day. Today it's the starters, so which dish will he think worthy of the banquet? Will it be poached & roasted chicken with new season onions, wild rabbit and leek turnover with piccalilli, or rabbit pudding with parched peas and gravy?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: For the fish course, which dish is going to be king: turbot with brown shrimps and spring vegetables, wild sea bass with shrimp toastie, or bream with hazelnuts and salted caramel?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fish course. Will the winning dish be Gloucester Old Spot pork with smoked venison, salt marsh lamb with sweetbreads, or oak roast middle white pork with broad beans?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Marcus Wareing chooses his favourite from the three dishes: caramel parfait with honey ice-cream, rhubarb and custard tart with beetroot ice-cream, and strawberries with meringue and mint water ice. For one of the chefs, this is the end of the road.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The heat is on, as only one chef can make it through to the finals and get the chance to cook at the banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is it going to be?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the starter course for three of London and the South East's hottest chefs - Matt Gillan, Lee Westcott and Marcus Wareing's protégé Mark Froydenlund. Returning contender Matt Gillan is determined to make it to this year's banquet, but he faces fierce competition in the two newcomers.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The London and South East chefs - Matt Gillan, Lee Westcott and Marcus Wareing's protégé Mark Froydenlund - go head to head with their fish courses. Lee is hoping his modern plate of mackerel and passion fruit will outclass Matt and Mark's more traditionally inspired salmon dishes.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's a battle for the main course for three of London and the South East's finest chefs - Matt Gillan, Lee Westcott and Mark Froydenlund. Returning contender Matt is determined to bring home a 10 with his ambitious celebration of the billy goat but has he bitten off more than he can chew?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's dessert day and the London and South East chefs are striving to secure one of the two spots in tomorrow's Regional Final. The scores are close, so it's all to play for, as today marks the end of the competition for one man.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining London and South East chefs are cooking all four courses again for the judges - Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort. They're joined by Mary Gwynn, author of the official WI centenary cookbook. Together they'll decide which chef goes through to represent the region in the National Finals.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Daniel Clifford, Richard Bainbridge and Will Holland launch their culinary assault with the starters: braised hog's head with apple sorbet, white onion soup with roasted muntjac, and rabbit and smoked bacon salad.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Daniel Clifford, Richard Bainbridge and Will Holland are all out to impress with their fish dishes: crab in barley soup with smoked oyster, hay baked rainbow trout and beetroot cured sea trout.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Daniel Clifford, Richard Bainbridge and Will Holland square off in the battle of the main courses. So which dish will get top marks: pigeon and rabbit with carrot terrine, lamb with purple sprouting broccoli or lamb with asparagus crown?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the chefs from the central region to prove they've got what it takes to cook at the banquet. So which dessert will it be, heather honey custard with rhubarb, queen of puddings or lavender junket with mead jelly?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The gloves are off, as only one chef can make through to the finals and get the chance to cook at the banquet. Who is going to come out fighting?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the starter course and as the chefs arrive they discover there's added competition following the London and South East region's shock result. The judges are joined by D-Day veteran George Batts.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fish course and those chefs who didn't make it onto the shortlist with their starters are hoping to do better. The judges are joined by Ken Sturdy who landed on Sword Beach on D-Day and who helped judge the North West region.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the halfway point in finals week and those chefs who have yet to get a dish onto the shortlist are feeling the heat. The judges are joined by Baroness Trumpington who worked as a cypher clerk at Bletchley Park from 1941 to 1946.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the chefs to get their dish in contention for the final banquet and those who've failed to finish in the top three so far are going all out. Joining the judges is Celia Sandys, Winston Churchill's granddaughter.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The pressure on the chefs to deliver is immense, and even the Great British Menu judges roll up their sleeves to ensure that the banquet goes according to plan.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three of Scotland's top chefs, Jak O'Donnell, Jimmy Lee, and Graham Campbell - attempt to impress this week's veteran judge. Having missed out last year, returning finalist Jak is determined to make it to the banquet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Scottish chefs Jak O'Donnell, Jimmy Lee and Graham Campbell fight it out for the fish course. Graham is in a confident mood but returning finalist Jak and self-taught Jimmy are pushing him hard. Will the pressure prove too much for ambitious Graham?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Scottish chefs Jak O'Donnell, Jimmy Lee and Graham Campbell are battling to plate up a perfect main course for this week's veteran chef. Self-taught Jimmy is honouring his mum with his rendition of her Chinese beef stew.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today it's the Scottish chefs' last chance to impress, with the dessert course. Only two can cook for the judges tomorrow, and with one chef in the lead after a triumphant main, the pressures on for the other two to plate up perfection.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining Scottish chefs cook their entire menus again for the judges - Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort. They're joined by WI Calendar Girl Angela Baker, who will help decide which chef will go forward to the National Finals.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three of the south west's finest chefs - Jude Kereama, Josh Eggleton and Dominic Chapman - attempt to impress a veteran judge with their starters. As the only newcomer in the kitchen, Jude is determined to plate up a winning dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The three south west chefs fight it out for the fish course. Despite schoolboy errors during the starter, experienced Dominic is determined to get a high score on the course. But will newcomer Jude, a seafood master, overcome his nerves to plate up?.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With a refined summer barbecue going up against a traditional Cornish speciality and a historic Wimbledon related recipe, who will come out on top? Andy Clatworthy is using his passion for historical cooking to reinvent a dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The south-west chefs have one last chance to impress as they face the dessert course. Only two chefs can go through to cook for the judges; with everything to play for, who will plate up perfection and who will be sent packing?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining south-west judges must cook their entire menus again for judges Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort. Joining the judges is Radhika Bynon, a member of the Forest Gate Women's Institute, a modern urban group of women.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Stephen Gomes, Adam Bannister and Phil Carmichael are challenged to plate up perfect starter courses for this week's veteran judge. It's the first time in the Great British Menu kitchen for all three chefs, so who will triumph and who will fall?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Stephen Gomes, Adam Bannister and Phil Carmichael fight it out for the fish course. Experimental chef Stephen is determined to prove himself with a fish course honouring the WI's tradition of preserving, but he's up against stiff competition.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's a battle for the main course with the Welsh chefs going head to head. With all three chefs paying homage to Welsh lamb; Adam with a refined dish, Phil with a dish dedicated to his Mum and Stephen with a lamb dish celebrating the WI.

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's main course day, the half-way point in Finals Week, and those chefs who have yet to get a dish on the shortlist are feeling the heat. With only dishes judged to be perfect in with a chance at reaching the WI banquet, the standards are higher than ever before.

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Odion tries to get the good Marik to resist his evil half. As a result, Yami Marik becomes angered, and attacks Odion with the Millennium Rod, which weakens Odion even more. Odion doesn't give up, despite Ishizu's protests. As Marik continues his onslaught (which begins to injure Odion), Odion tells Marik's good side that together, they had conquered his evil half before, and that they could do it again. Then, he tells the good Marik that since Yami Marik was created by the good Marik's hatred, he has the power to destroy him. As Yami Marik raises the Rod to deliver the final blow, the good Marik disappears from the field, and begins fighting against Yami Marik, who struggles for control over Marik's body, and refuses to be defeated. However, Marik's good half stalls Yami Marik long enough for Yugi to activate his spell card. Yugi's Ragnarok spell succeeds in destroying (and removing to the graveyard) Ra, allowing the good Marik to regain control of his body. However, a sliver of Yami Marik reappears on the field, although this time, he is the victim. Yami Marik tries to convince the good Marik to help him seize the Millennium Items and rule the world together, but fails as Marik has decided to stop being evil and make up for his actions. Marik surrenders the duel to Yugi, which sends Yami Marik to the Shadow Realm, ending the Battle City finals. Bakura and Mai are returned from the shadow realm and Marik is reunited with his siblings, who forgive him. Yugi receives the three Egyptian God Cards. Kaiba then activates the Duel Tower's self-destruct sequence, giving everybody one hour to get off the island before it explodes.

programme.title: My Dream Farm
programme.desc: Monty visits city girl Jen and her country cousin Bek who have started a flower farm in Kent.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty helps two families create dream gardens that are as much for the children as for the adults. In Doncaster, Nikki and John want a garden full of edible plants and fruit.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty faces some of the most surprising plans yet - a Norwegian garden complete with waterfalls to be fashioned out of a tiny back yard in Dorset, and nothing less than a Japanese tea garden to be created out of a patch of ground in Bromley.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The team are Birmingham-bound for the annual Gardeners' World Live event. Monty Don, Arit Anderson, Adam Frost, Sue Kent, Carol Klein, Joe Swift, Rachel de Thame and Frances Tophill present the best the gardening world has to offer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With summertime at its peak, Adam plans to extend the season with plants for evening scent and shares the results of his wild meadow turf experiment. In North Yorkshire, Nick Bailey discovers the range of floral beauty of Cornus kousa.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: Low turkey numbers and a few trespassers made this season tougher than normal. John hits a couple states in pursuit of a few gobblers, but ends up not punching his last tag for a reason that is not to common and often not discussed in conservation circles.

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: Never in a million years did I think I would be in Spain, much less hunting… An opportunity to chase true 100% Balerian Goats on the island of Mallorca presented itself after the 2023 season was already planned and set in motion. What do you? You make every effort to make it happen! Logistics, flight delays, and language barriers turned a 4 day hunt into 2. Witnessing their conservation efforts was definitely the highlight of the trip. Although different, it very much works for them and something others could learn from as we hunt to protect these species. Saddle up for a wild 2 days!

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: When Under Armour became the Title Sponsor of the Tactical Games, well…. I actually learned what the Tactical Games were. Kinda cross fit, kinda strong man all mixed with AR and pistol shooting. Ok, Sign me up!! But what did I just sign up for?! I was about to find out!

programme.title: Primal Divide

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "In this episode of Huckberry Homes, we traveled down to Jacksonville, Florida to meet up with longtime friend, GORUCK Co-founder, and former Special Forces Green Beret Jason McCarthy. When he’s not rucking to and from the GORUCK HQ, you can find him and his friends putting on grueling garage workouts that are the talk of the neighborhood. Huckberry and GORUCK go way back, we’ve shared plenty of good times, GORUCK Challenges, and (more than) a few beers along the way. Their military-grade lineup is designed to be taken to hell and back in the field. So whether you’re traveling the world or “embracing the suck” with a 30 LB plate in your rucksack, you can be sure your gear’s up to the challenge."

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "In this special edition episode of Huckberry Homes, we travel to New York to get a rare look inside The Explorers Club headquarters. For the last 120 years, The Explorers Club has been the exclusive epicenter where legendary explorers come together to share some of the most incredible adventure stories ever told. From Roald Amundsen’s 1911 voyage to the South Pole to Sir Edmund Hillary’s ascent to the summit of Mount Everest to astronauts Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin’s history-changing 1969 expedition to the moon, the halls of this institution have echoed with tales of daring discovery and unparalleled human achievement. That’s why we’re beyond stoked to kick off our Huckberry x The Explorers Club partnership—featuring the Land, Sea, and Space Collection from an exclusive Whiskey Peaks collab and a badass grand prize. Tune in now to watch a tour so exclusive, it’s almost like being inducted into the club itself (minus the secret handshake)."

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "On this special edition of Huckberry Homes, we explore Floki Studios. Floki Studios is a renowned recording studio nestled in the rugged seaside of Iceland, offering artists an unparalleled environment for creativity and collaboration. Situated on the fringes of the Arctic Circle, this sanctuary provides a haven far removed from the bustling distractions of urban life. Surrounded by the untouched beauty of Iceland's pristine nature, Floki Studios is more than just a recording space; it's a haven designed to inspire and enhance the creative journey.Behind the scenes, Floki Studios thrives thanks to a dedicated team, deeply committed to the art of music. Jay Sweet, the Music Ambassador, stands out for his passion and advocacy for artists, embodying the studio's ethos of nurturing creativity. This partnership between Jay and the Floki Studios team exemplifies a unique blend of individual dedication and collective effort, providing artists with a space that fosters creative freedom and collaboration."

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "On this episode of Huckberry Homes, we drove out the Texas Hill Country to see our good friend Cameron Duddy. When he’s not touring around the world with his band Midland, you can find him out on his ranch, deep in the heart of Texas. Cameron gave us the lay of the land, showing us everything from a creative oasis he calls an office, to the places he enjoys most with family and friends.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: This episode of Huckberry Homes brings us out to the Western Slope, just a few miles outside of Vail, Colorado to visit our longtime friend and collaborator Sinuhe Xavier. When he's not traveling the world shooting commercials and making short films, Xavier's at home in his quiet, perfectly appointed retreat deep in the Rockies here he's a three hour drive from Red Rock desert and a ten minute drive from some of the best snowboarding in the world. There was plenty of magic in Sinuhe's spot, from his BMW GS to his exploration of how his love for his son shaped the design and decoration of his pad.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "On this episode of Huckberry Homes, we caught our good friend and photographer James Barkman out in the wild. He gave us a tour of his vintage ""Yellow Submarine"" inspired VW Van and broke down some of the modifications he has made to make this adventure bus feel more like home.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Anyone can be a cowboy—that’s the biggest thing the DIRT crew learned in Texas. From riding bulls in Fort Worth to off-roading in the Chihuahuan desert to forging their own path across this vast state with the help of local trailblazers Liz and Lou Lambert. Lucky for us, they even stopped by Huckberry’s own backyard in Austin for a quick ruck and a couple games of chicken sh*t bingo. When the dust finally settled, we fired up the barbecue for our beefiest feast yet and raised our ranch waters high to 10 DIRT episodes in the can.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: On this trip, Mark finds himself in Eastern Colorado looking for a big mature Mule Deer. Eastern Colorado is known for some of the best spot and stalk Mule Deer hunting in the US. With the rut in full swing, seeing bucks isn't usually a problem. But getting in range of a big mature buck can be a challenge. Mark spots the mature deer he wants to pursue and spends all of his time trying to get.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is in for an adrenaline-packed adventure in Croatia as he targets the elusive Kri Kri Ibex and Mouflon. With expert guides and unwavering determination, Mark navigates rugged terrain and thrilling hunts, showcasing the excitement and skill of the hunting industry.As his time in Croatia winds down, the episode captures the essence of ethical practices and the intense pursuit that defines this exhilarating sport. Don’t miss the epic conclusion to Mark’s expedition, where passion, skill, and the thrill of the hunt converge in unforgettable moments.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson heads North to Alberta on a late season Elk hunt. This is a very unique hunt where Mark has an Alberta Ministers tag which means 100% of the revenue from this tag goes back to the province of Alberta to fund conservation program studies for Elk, Bighorn Sheep and Mule deer. This is a great program that gives back to the wildlife.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Accompany Mark Peterson on his ongoing expedition through California, where he pursues the elusive Tule Elk. Notably, the elk inhabiting this region underwent reclassification from Roosevelt to Tule elk in 2023. Recalling his previous hunt in 2019 with his rifle, Mark is now equipped with his Gunwerks Muzzleloader and he endeavors to achieve optimal proximity for a successful encounter.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson heads south to Florida after an alligator. On this adventure, Mark is toting his Gunwerks BlastR handgun as he hunts the swamps with his sights set on a big mature gator. Alligators are typically judged in the field by looking at the distance from their eyes to the tip of their nose. The rule of thumb is that they grow a foot in length every year until they are eight years old, then grown an inch per year after that. At 13 feet 3 inches, this old gator is one for the books.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is still in Florida and looking for gator number two. After being successful on the morning hunt with his Gunwerks, Mark adds the AMS big game bowfishing kit to his Mathews and heads back out to the swamps in search of his first gator with a bow. It took a few shots to get dialed in, but he eventually connected with gator number two on this trip to the sunshine state.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson’s Journey in Argentina continues with some morning madness. Taking four animals, this is one of the best morning hunts he has had yet. After an already incredible week of hunting, Mark is looking for a few species that caught his attention earlier in the trip and turns up a Hybrid Sheep, Hybrid Mouflon, Feral Goat and a Multi Horn Sheep. Temps are abnormally hot in Argentina for this time of year and the animals will be heading for cover by mid day to stay cool. Mark and his guide Charley make a plan to cover a lot of ground in hopes of catching them out feeding before they disappear.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark and his dogs travel West to Nebraska to hunt free range Pheasants with his dad Earl. Mark and Earl are hosted by Worldwide Trophy Adventures CEO Ryan Watchorn. The group spends two days getting after a limit of pheasants while also getting Ryan’s son his first bird.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson continues his quest on the Hearst Ranch in California. Next up on the list, California Aoudad. These Aoudad were introduced to the ranch in the early 1920s and have thrived ever since.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: In this episode, Mark Peterson chases after a Red Stag, Black Buck and Fallow deer. There’s no shortage of action in this video. Argentina's borders were closed during the peak of COVID, so these animals have not been hunted for two years, which led to a game rich environment and excellent trophy quality. On this adventure, Mark is joined by his dad Earl, brother Aaron and nephew Alec to chase some of the biggest free-range Red Stags in the world. Stay tuned for more on this family adventure in Argentina.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark's time in Argentina is winding down and he needs just one more species before moving on to Peru: the Brazilian Teal. The guides have seen a few in the area so Mark and his crew try some new tactics, hoping to close in on the 13th and final species on this leg of the journey.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: A Southwest Mississippi GIANT “Barry” has made more daylight appearances than possibly any mature bucks in existence. Now that Slade is back from the midwest The chase is on.

programme.title: FinQuest

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Shotgun sports are experiencing unprecedented growth, with competitions across the country gaining popularity as enthusiasts vie to be the best shooters in the world. Every summer, the Amateur Trapshooting Association hosts The Grand American in Sparta, Illinois. This year marks the 125th Anniversary for the largest trap shooting competition in the world. We’ll talk with the people who make this tournament run behind the scenes and explore what makes this tournament such a special event. We’ll also look at the rich history of The Grand. On-site we’ll chat with the curator of the Trapshooting Hall of Fame and look at some of the incredible historical pieces on display in the museum. Additionally, we’ll learn about White Flyer and how the clay manufacturer has made important innovations for the shotgun sports.

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: Low turkey numbers and a few trespassers made this season tougher than normal. John hits a couple states in pursuit of a few gobblers, but ends up not punching his last tag for a reason that is not to common and often not discussed in conservation circles.

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: Never in a million years did I think I would be in Spain, much less hunting… An opportunity to chase true 100% Balerian Goats on the island of Mallorca presented itself after the 2023 season was already planned and set in motion. What do you? You make every effort to make it happen! Logistics, flight delays, and language barriers turned a 4 day hunt into 2. Witnessing their conservation efforts was definitely the highlight of the trip. Although different, it very much works for them and something others could learn from as we hunt to protect these species. Saddle up for a wild 2 days!

programme.title: Primal Divide

programme.title: Primal Divide

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "In this episode of Huckberry Homes, we traveled down to Jacksonville, Florida to meet up with longtime friend, GORUCK Co-founder, and former Special Forces Green Beret Jason McCarthy. When he’s not rucking to and from the GORUCK HQ, you can find him and his friends putting on grueling garage workouts that are the talk of the neighborhood. Huckberry and GORUCK go way back, we’ve shared plenty of good times, GORUCK Challenges, and (more than) a few beers along the way. Their military-grade lineup is designed to be taken to hell and back in the field. So whether you’re traveling the world or “embracing the suck” with a 30 LB plate in your rucksack, you can be sure your gear’s up to the challenge."

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "In this special edition episode of Huckberry Homes, we travel to New York to get a rare look inside The Explorers Club headquarters. For the last 120 years, The Explorers Club has been the exclusive epicenter where legendary explorers come together to share some of the most incredible adventure stories ever told. From Roald Amundsen’s 1911 voyage to the South Pole to Sir Edmund Hillary’s ascent to the summit of Mount Everest to astronauts Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin’s history-changing 1969 expedition to the moon, the halls of this institution have echoed with tales of daring discovery and unparalleled human achievement. That’s why we’re beyond stoked to kick off our Huckberry x The Explorers Club partnership—featuring the Land, Sea, and Space Collection from an exclusive Whiskey Peaks collab and a badass grand prize. Tune in now to watch a tour so exclusive, it’s almost like being inducted into the club itself (minus the secret handshake)."

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "On this special edition of Huckberry Homes, we explore Floki Studios. Floki Studios is a renowned recording studio nestled in the rugged seaside of Iceland, offering artists an unparalleled environment for creativity and collaboration. Situated on the fringes of the Arctic Circle, this sanctuary provides a haven far removed from the bustling distractions of urban life. Surrounded by the untouched beauty of Iceland's pristine nature, Floki Studios is more than just a recording space; it's a haven designed to inspire and enhance the creative journey.Behind the scenes, Floki Studios thrives thanks to a dedicated team, deeply committed to the art of music. Jay Sweet, the Music Ambassador, stands out for his passion and advocacy for artists, embodying the studio's ethos of nurturing creativity. This partnership between Jay and the Floki Studios team exemplifies a unique blend of individual dedication and collective effort, providing artists with a space that fosters creative freedom and collaboration."

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "On this episode of Huckberry Homes, we drove out the Texas Hill Country to see our good friend Cameron Duddy. When he’s not touring around the world with his band Midland, you can find him out on his ranch, deep in the heart of Texas. Cameron gave us the lay of the land, showing us everything from a creative oasis he calls an office, to the places he enjoys most with family and friends.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: This episode of Huckberry Homes brings us out to the Western Slope, just a few miles outside of Vail, Colorado to visit our longtime friend and collaborator Sinuhe Xavier. When he's not traveling the world shooting commercials and making short films, Xavier's at home in his quiet, perfectly appointed retreat deep in the Rockies here he's a three hour drive from Red Rock desert and a ten minute drive from some of the best snowboarding in the world. There was plenty of magic in Sinuhe's spot, from his BMW GS to his exploration of how his love for his son shaped the design and decoration of his pad.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "On this episode of Huckberry Homes, we caught our good friend and photographer James Barkman out in the wild. He gave us a tour of his vintage ""Yellow Submarine"" inspired VW Van and broke down some of the modifications he has made to make this adventure bus feel more like home.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Anyone can be a cowboy—that’s the biggest thing the DIRT crew learned in Texas. From riding bulls in Fort Worth to off-roading in the Chihuahuan desert to forging their own path across this vast state with the help of local trailblazers Liz and Lou Lambert. Lucky for us, they even stopped by Huckberry’s own backyard in Austin for a quick ruck and a couple games of chicken sh*t bingo. When the dust finally settled, we fired up the barbecue for our beefiest feast yet and raised our ranch waters high to 10 DIRT episodes in the can.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: On this trip, Mark finds himself in Eastern Colorado looking for a big mature Mule Deer. Eastern Colorado is known for some of the best spot and stalk Mule Deer hunting in the US. With the rut in full swing, seeing bucks isn't usually a problem. But getting in range of a big mature buck can be a challenge. Mark spots the mature deer he wants to pursue and spends all of his time trying to get.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is in for an adrenaline-packed adventure in Croatia as he targets the elusive Kri Kri Ibex and Mouflon. With expert guides and unwavering determination, Mark navigates rugged terrain and thrilling hunts, showcasing the excitement and skill of the hunting industry.As his time in Croatia winds down, the episode captures the essence of ethical practices and the intense pursuit that defines this exhilarating sport. Don’t miss the epic conclusion to Mark’s expedition, where passion, skill, and the thrill of the hunt converge in unforgettable moments.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson heads North to Alberta on a late season Elk hunt. This is a very unique hunt where Mark has an Alberta Ministers tag which means 100% of the revenue from this tag goes back to the province of Alberta to fund conservation program studies for Elk, Bighorn Sheep and Mule deer. This is a great program that gives back to the wildlife.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Accompany Mark Peterson on his ongoing expedition through California, where he pursues the elusive Tule Elk. Notably, the elk inhabiting this region underwent reclassification from Roosevelt to Tule elk in 2023. Recalling his previous hunt in 2019 with his rifle, Mark is now equipped with his Gunwerks Muzzleloader and he endeavors to achieve optimal proximity for a successful encounter.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson heads south to Florida after an alligator. On this adventure, Mark is toting his Gunwerks BlastR handgun as he hunts the swamps with his sights set on a big mature gator. Alligators are typically judged in the field by looking at the distance from their eyes to the tip of their nose. The rule of thumb is that they grow a foot in length every year until they are eight years old, then grown an inch per year after that. At 13 feet 3 inches, this old gator is one for the books.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is still in Florida and looking for gator number two. After being successful on the morning hunt with his Gunwerks, Mark adds the AMS big game bowfishing kit to his Mathews and heads back out to the swamps in search of his first gator with a bow. It took a few shots to get dialed in, but he eventually connected with gator number two on this trip to the sunshine state.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson’s Journey in Argentina continues with some morning madness. Taking four animals, this is one of the best morning hunts he has had yet. After an already incredible week of hunting, Mark is looking for a few species that caught his attention earlier in the trip and turns up a Hybrid Sheep, Hybrid Mouflon, Feral Goat and a Multi Horn Sheep. Temps are abnormally hot in Argentina for this time of year and the animals will be heading for cover by mid day to stay cool. Mark and his guide Charley make a plan to cover a lot of ground in hopes of catching them out feeding before they disappear.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark and his dogs travel West to Nebraska to hunt free range Pheasants with his dad Earl. Mark and Earl are hosted by Worldwide Trophy Adventures CEO Ryan Watchorn. The group spends two days getting after a limit of pheasants while also getting Ryan’s son his first bird.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson continues his quest on the Hearst Ranch in California. Next up on the list, California Aoudad. These Aoudad were introduced to the ranch in the early 1920s and have thrived ever since.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: In this episode, Mark Peterson chases after a Red Stag, Black Buck and Fallow deer. There’s no shortage of action in this video. Argentina's borders were closed during the peak of COVID, so these animals have not been hunted for two years, which led to a game rich environment and excellent trophy quality. On this adventure, Mark is joined by his dad Earl, brother Aaron and nephew Alec to chase some of the biggest free-range Red Stags in the world. Stay tuned for more on this family adventure in Argentina.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark's time in Argentina is winding down and he needs just one more species before moving on to Peru: the Brazilian Teal. The guides have seen a few in the area so Mark and his crew try some new tactics, hoping to close in on the 13th and final species on this leg of the journey.

programme.title: FinQuest

Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Shotgun sports are experiencing unprecedented growth, with competitions across the country gaining popularity as enthusiasts vie to be the best shooters in the world. Every summer, the Amateur Trapshooting Association hosts The Grand American in Sparta, Illinois. This year marks the 125th Anniversary for the largest trap shooting competition in the world. We’ll talk with the people who make this tournament run behind the scenes and explore what makes this tournament such a special event. We’ll also look at the rich history of The Grand. On-site we’ll chat with the curator of the Trapshooting Hall of Fame and look at some of the incredible historical pieces on display in the museum. Additionally, we’ll learn about White Flyer and how the clay manufacturer has made important innovations for the shotgun sports.

programme.title: Hero
programme.desc: When her plane crashes into a Chicago bridge, ace reporter Gale Gayley is saved by a mysterious and unlikely hero in this heart-warming comedy.

programme.title: Christmas on Division Street
programme.desc: Follows the unlikely friendship between a bullied teenage school boy and the unhomed American history buff he wants to help before Christmas.

programme.title: Immediate Family
programme.desc: An upscale couple unable to conceive arrange a brokered adoption with a pregnant woman who doesn’t hold up her end of the deal to give up the baby.

programme.title: Heartsounds
programme.desc: A near-fatal heart attack sends a New York urologist and his writer wife into a battle against a medical institution unable or unwilling to help him.

programme.desc: In a Connecticut suburb, Ned notices there are pools throughout the neighborhood and decides to "swim" home via the pools of his wealthy friends.

programme.title: Don't Knock the Twist

programme.title: First Men in the Moon
programme.desc: Convinced they’re the first men on the moon, three astronauts discover evidence of a lunar landing decades earlier and track down its sole survivor.

programme.title: Convicted
programme.desc: During a barroom brawl, Joe Hufford (Glenn Ford) accidentally kills the son of a powerful, prominent man. The district attorney, George Knowland (Broderick Crawford), wins a manslaughter conviction, despite having doubts about the defendant's guilt. Joe is sent to prison, and George, who eventually becomes the warden there, hopes to get him released. But Joe gets so immersed in the culture and codes of the jailhouse that he finds it difficult to believe in his own innocence.

programme.title: Pal Joey
programme.desc: Charming musical featuring the love triangle between a lovable but mischievous man and the two women who could change his life, for love or money.

programme.title: Tight Spot
programme.desc: A lawyer springs a wise-cracking model from jail to convince her to testify against a no-good mobster, but a besotted cop throws a wrench in the plan.

programme.title: Murderer's Row
programme.desc: Secret agent Matt Helm must rescue the kidnapped inventor of an ultra-destructive "helio beam" capable of destroying Washington, D.C.

programme.title: Divorce American Style
programme.desc: A nouveau-riche L.A. couple decide to call it quits after 17 years of marriage, but alimony woes send the bachelor in search of a husband for his ex.

programme.title: Let No Man Write My Epitaph
programme.desc: Nick Romano (James Darren) lives in a poor tenement building on the south side of Chicago with his well-meaning but drug-addicted mother, Nellie (Shelley Winters). She encourages him to pursue his piano-playing talent in hopes that it will bring him a better life. Nellie's neighbors, like the alcoholic ex-lawyer (Burl Ives) who secretly loves her, help her in keeping Nick away from Louie, the resident drug dealer. But a chance meeting between Nick and Louie could change things forever.

programme.title: The Taming of the Shrew
programme.desc: A rich merchant's beautiful daughter and her volatile older sister are courted by rival suitors in this rambunctious version of Shakespeare's comedy.

programme.title: All the Young Men
programme.desc: After taking command of a Marine platoon during the Korean War, a Black sergeant struggles to rally the white soldiers to complete a critical mission.

programme.title: The Goddess
programme.desc: As a child, she was Emily Ann, a poor girl in the South with no friends and an ineffective mother. But as an adult, she's Rita Shawn (Kim Stanley), an actress loved the world over. Still, all the money and fame in the world can't buy happiness, and Rita is plagued with depression over her broken relationships -- first to a handsome soldier (Steve Hill) and then to a boxing promoter (Lloyd Bridges) -- and her lack of any emotional connections to anyone outside of her professional life.

programme.title: Loss of Innocence
programme.desc: Left alone because of their mother's sudden hospitalization during a vacation in France, four British children have to fend for themselves. They stay at a hotel, where, despite the reticence of owner Madame Zisi (Danielle Darrieux), they are befriended by her lover, Eliot (Kenneth More). Joss (Susannah York), the eldest of the children, runs afoul of Madame Zisi, who thinks Eliot is spending too much time with her and causes a scene. Robbed of Eliot's attention, Joss denounces him to the police.

programme.title: Hamlet
programme.desc: The prince's quest for revenge becomes his undoing when his suspicion is confirmed that his uncle killed his father to win the throne and his mother.

programme.title: Our Wife
programme.desc: A composer (Melvyn Douglas) goes on a cruise and meets a woman (Ruth Hussey) he likes more than his wife (Ellen Drew).

programme.title: Decameron Nights
programme.desc: While trying to woo a noblewoman in Florence, Italian poet Boccaccio tells three tales of love in this romance based on the author's writings.

programme.title: There's Always a Woman
programme.desc: An investigator for the district attorney and his amateur sleuth wife compete to solve a murder mystery behind the death of a woman's husband.

programme.title: Duffy

programme.title: Love Affair
programme.desc: Jim Leonard, a penniless aviator and airplane mechanic, falls in love with the wealthy Carol Owen while giving her flying lessons.

programme.desc: Shawnee chief Tecumseh (Jay Silverheels) helps a government agent (Jon Hall) catch traitors before the War of 1812.
